subject: SOAPEnvelope ClassCastException in using swingui.TestRunner
msgSnippet: Hi, I am writing test code for soap service. I wanted to print xml stream to a file. While I write the content of SOAPEnvelope object using textui.TestRunner,
messageBody:
Hi,
I am writing test code for soap service. I wanted to print xml stream
to a file.

While I write the content of SOAPEnvelope object using
textui.TestRunner, I am able to cast the soapenvelope to
org.dom4j.Node.

While I run the same code using swingui.TestRunner the same object
was now being some other interface and gives a classcast exception.
Interesting thing is the same thing works when I unchecked "reload
classes every run".

Are you aware of this problem? Any fix to this?

thanks
Senthil



pseudo code:
SOAPEnvelope env = request.getSOAPPart().getEnvelope
();
// writing to a file
XMLWriter writer = new XMLWriter(new java.io.FileWriter
("getSource_request.xml"), (OutputFormat)
OutputFormat.createPrettyPrint());
if( env instanceof SOAPEnvelope)
System.out.println("it is a soapenvelope");
if (env instanceof org.dom4j.Node) { // correct
writer.write( (org.dom4j.Node)env );
System.out.println("It is an instance of node");
} else if(env instanceof
com.sun.xml.messaging.saaj.soap.dom4j.EnvelopeImpl) { // wrong
System.out.println("It is an instance of
com.sun.xml.messaging.saaj.soap.dom4j.EnvelopeImpl");
writer.write( ""+body.toString() );
}
writer.write( (org.dom4j.Node)env );
